description:
Staphylococcus epidermidis BCM-HMP0060 is a strain of the bacterium Staphylococcus epidermidis, which is a Gram-positive, coagulase-negative, and opportunistic pathogen commonly found on the human skin and mucous membranes. 

This specific strain, BCM-HMP0060, was isolated as part of the Human Microbiome Project (HMP), which aimed to characterize the microbial communities associated with the human body. S. epidermidis BCM-HMP0060 is a non-motile, spherical-shaped bacterium that typically appears in clusters or pairs when observed under a microscope.

As a commensal bacterium, S. epidermidis BCM-HMP0060 is generally considered a harmless member of the human microbiome. However, in immunocompromised individuals or in the presence of medical devices, such as catheters or implants, this strain can potentially cause opportunistic infections, such as skin and soft tissue infections, as well as bloodstream infections.

Genomic analysis of S. epidermidis BCM-HMP0060 may provide insights into its metabolic capabilities, virulence factors, and potential interactions with the human host, which can contribute to our understanding of the role of this bacterium in human health and disease.
